desc: Research clearly shows that labeling isolated sentence components with grammatical terms, drilling workbook exercises, and diagramming sentences are ineffective classroom practices. What can teachers do to help their students gain mastery of standard written English? In this half-credit course, students explore both the theory and practice of contextual grammar instruction. Students also hone their own grammatical knowledge, applying their new knowledge of both content and pedagogy through in-class micro-teachings. Offered annually in the second half of the spring semester.
name: Teach/Learn Engl Grammar
notes: Closed to first-year students. Students who wish to register for both Ed 245 half of semester course) and Ed 321 (2nd half of semester course) should contact the instructor. Ed 321 will be added after registration closes.
title: Teaching and Learning English Grammar
